result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:07 PMCO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer in court, Defendant Erin K. Coffin did not appear. JSC in court. Includes 21CF876(STC), 21CF948 (STC), 22CF1 (STC) and 22CF220 (ARGN). Court reviews case.  Court questions DE's non appearance. Atty Selmer does not know DE's whereabouts. ADA Ballo reviews JSC reports and requests warrants on all files. Atty Selmer makes statements. Court issues warrant- body only - adjoining states. Adjourned 02:17 PM

records.addlTxt: Supplemental Report-JSC. Includes 22CF220, 22CF001, 22CF948, 22CF876. Filed by Kelli S. arc   to ty

ADDRESS INFO for Erin K. Coffin
Current: PO Box 304, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2022)
Prior: 418 N Winter St, River Falls, WI 54022 United States
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CF876, 21CF948, 22CF1 & 22CF220 (STC):
 CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michelle Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Erin K. Coffin appeared. Case called at 4:02 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a status conference. Atty Selmer gives update on remote testing device. Spoke to JSC and they are trying to figure out how to assist DE. She is now residing at Turning Point. Court notes most files are assigned to Branch 2. New file is a bail jumping charge and will be reassigned. Atty Selmer reviews right to preliminary hearing with client. DE will waive. On 22CF220, Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will schedule 22CF220 with Branch 2. ADA Brekken after speaking to JSC states DE has absconded from testing and they have not had any follow though by DE. Court directs DE to report to JSC immediately after Court. Newest file will be reassigned to Branch 2. DE needs to update Court with PO BOX. Court adjourned at 4:15 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF220 (RW/INIT). 21CF876, 21CF948 & 22CF1 (RW):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito & Travis Satorius   DF:  Erin K. Coffin appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:02 p.m. Court reviews files. Warrants were issued for non appearance. Initial appearance on 22CF220. DE has a copy of complaint. Address confirmed. Qualifies for PD services. State requesting cash bond. Atty Dippolito argues bond. Atty Selmer is attorney on other files. Will reach out to see if he will accept this file. Court schedules. QUASH WARRANTS. JSC representative present. DE has not been testing by SCRAM unit since April. DE states SCRAM unit is in River Falls. Court orders DE to report to JSC after release to be issued a new device.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Court takes judicial notice on case 21CF876. Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Includes 21CF876, 21CF948, and 22CF1.

03:13 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Erin K. Coffin appears via zoom. Includes 21CF876, 21CF948, and 22CF1. Court reviews case. 21CF876: ADA Ballo requests to take care of Motion filed in case 21CF876. Court agrees. ADA Ballo denies motion of insufficient facts. Atty Selmer states there is no evidence submitted other than officer hearsay evidence. Atty Selmer to withdraw motion. Atty Selmer to file another motion. Court radifies NG. Enter with reservation on all pre plea rights. Atty Selmer waives speedy prelim in case 21CF948 and 22CF1. Court sets STC 21CF876 and PH on 21CF948 and 22CF1. Adjourned 03:23 PM  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Selmer. km

Includes 21CF948 and 22CF1.

Defendant to test clean before release.

Defendant to contact Pierce County Human Services to see if there are any pretrial services that can be offered to her.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
Pre-trial conference on January 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:24 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow  DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and Kaitlin Dippolito for today   DF:  Erin K. Coffin appeared from jail. Includes 21CF948 and 22CF1. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD- Atty Selmer assigned to underlying case. Bond argument; bond ordered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
